meanings.definition: To undo stitches in (a piece of sewing).
meanings.sent1: She had to unpick the mistake in her sewing project.
meanings.sent2: The tailor needed to unpick the hem to make adjustments.
meanings.sent3: It was like a puzzle trying to unpick the tangled threads.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to unpick the carefully woven fabric of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The seamstress carefully unpicked each stitch to fix the error.

meanings.definition: To remove or take apart (something) by undoing stitches.
meanings.sent1: He had to unpick the old patches from the jacket.
meanings.sent2: The child tried to unpick the toy to see how it worked.
meanings.sent3: It was like trying to unpick a knot in a shoelace.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to unpick the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: She carefully unpicked the seams of the old quilt to repurpose the fabric.
